text:
Apple TV + streaming service officially launched in Russia. Students free
01 Nov 2019, 07:28 by Victor Podvolotsky
At the start, the service offers 1 documentary and 7 series.
On November 1, the Apple TV + streaming service officially launched in Russia. Users gained access to the original content for 199 rubles per month. The first 7 days of subscription are free.
Currently, the service offers 1 documentary and 7 series, including: ‚ÄúSee‚Äù with Jason Momoa, ‚ÄúDickinson‚Äù with Haley Steinfield and ‚ÄúMorning Show‚Äù with Reese Witherspoon and Jennifer Aniston. All series are available with subtitles, only "Helpers" have Russian voice acting.
You can watch movies and TV shows on Apple TV + on iPhone, iPad, iPod Touch, Mac, Apple TV, as well as on smart TVs Samsung, Sony, LG, Vizio and in the browser. You can familiarize yourself with the content and subscribe through the official website of the service.
If you already have a student subscription to Apple Music, then you will receive free access to the new service at no extra charge. Apple has not yet specified how long this promotion will last. You do not need to connect anything: the subscription expands automatically.
